abstract:
GitHub is migrating its public API system from REST to GraphQL. In this
talk, I'd like to go over my personal experiences writing API
documentation for ten years, and why GraphQL's "everything needs
documentation" approach is a much needed improvement. I'd go over past
API tooling and methodologies, current best practices to make "sane"
autogenerated API documentation, and why I think that GraphQL is a boon
for technical writers, developers, and end users.
title: Finally! Trustworthy and Sensible API Documentation with GraphQL
